label: Clamshell
desc: iRecycle identified the waste as a clamshell box! This is not recyclable in King County, so throw it in the trash.

label: Soda Can
desc: iRecycle identified the waste as soda can. Give it a quick rinse and put it in the recycle bin!

label: Yogurt
desc: iRecycle identified the waste as yogurt cup. Wash the cup, then remove the peel-off lid and outside label and dispose those items in the trash. The plastic container is recyclable!

label: Water Bottle
desc: iRecycle identified the waste as water bottle. Make sure the bottle is empty, then take off the bottle cap and plastic label on desc bottle and dispose in the trash. The clear plastic bottle is recyclable!

label: Mylar Bag
desc: iRecycle identified the waste as non-recyclable plastic. Snack bags cannot be recycled. Alternative tip: Buy in bulk and use reusable snack containers to reduce waste!

label: Plastic Wrap
desc: iRecycle identified the waste as plastic wrap. This item is not recyclable. Alternative tip: Try beeswax wrap that can be washed and reused!

label: Foil
desc: iRecycle identified the waste as foil. Most foil is not recyclable as it is soiled with food and grease. Try to reuse your foil as much as possible if necessary to use.

label: Plastic Bag
desc: iRecycle identified the waste as plastic bag. Plastic bags are not recyclable. If possible, bring reusable tote bags for grocery shopping!👜

label: Paper
desc: iRecycle identified the waste as paper. Most paper is recyclable. Just make sure the paper is not contaminated with food or liquid, is not shredded, and does not have wax coating.📰

label: Compost
desc: iRecycle identified the waste as compost. You can either have an outdoor compost pile, or use an indoor compost bin!

label: Mask
desc: iRecycle identified the waste as a mask. Masks are not recyclable. Try to reuse your masks for as long as possible.
